page.title: 06SMEATHARPE-RICH IN FAUNA
page.content: The Smeatharpe area has hedgerows and fields which provide a habitat and food for a great variety of birds, insects and other wildlife. Among the common birds are:robin, blackbird, housemartin, blue tit, great tit, buzzard and various hawks. The animals include the rabbit, hare, fox, hedgehog, badger, rat, mole, shrew, fieldmouse, frog and toad. Common insects are: woodlice, lady- bird, earwig, honey bee, field grass- hopper, wasp, ant, greenfly, cricket, cranefly, housefly, centipede, pond- skater, lacewing, various species of beetles and spiders. Among the butterflies are the cabbage- white, meadowbrown and red admiral. The moths are elephant hawk and poplar hawk. There are also slugs, snails, common- earthworms, lizards and grass-snakes.
